com.jacobschneider.engine.physics

Class RigidBody6DOF

  • Object
    • RigidBody6DOF
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PhysicsBody

    public class RigidBody6DOF
extends Object
implements PhysicsBody
    A perfect rigid body physics object with a full 6 degrees of freedom.
    Author:
    Jacob

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface PhysicsBody

    • Method Detail

      • fixBody

        public final void fixBody()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Fixes the body completely in space. Gives the body infinite mass and infinite rotational inertia.
        Specified by:
        fixBody in interface PhysicsBody

      • constrainBody

        public final void constrainBody(Manifold constraint)
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Constraints the position of this body to a Manifold. The body must initially be on the manifold and the constraint will ensure that the velocity of this body is always tangent to the manifold.
        Specified by:
        constrainBody in interface PhysicsBody
        Parameters:
        constraint - Manifold that acts as a constraint

      • fixPosition

        public final void fixPosition()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Fixes the position of a body in space. Gives the body infinite mass.
        Specified by:
        fixPosition in interface PhysicsBody

      • fixRotation

        public final void fixRotation()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Fixes the rotation of a body in space. Gives the body infinite rotational inertia.
        Specified by:
        fixRotation in interface PhysicsBody

      • fixAxes

        public final void fixAxes(Set<PhysicsBody.Axis> axes)
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Fixes the rotation of a body in space around a set of axes. If an axis is fixed the body cannot rotate around that axis. These axes are the body coordinate basis. Supplying this method with a set of all 3 axis is identical to calling PhysicsBody.fixRotation().
        Specified by:
        fixAxes in interface PhysicsBody
        Parameters:
        axes - The set of axis you want to fix rotation around.

      • fixRotationAroundAxis

        public void fixRotationAroundAxis(Vector3 axisBody,
                                  double scalerInertia)
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Prevents all rotation except around a certain arbitrary axis (body coordinates). The scaler inertia of the axis is set to the scalerInertia parameter.
        Specified by:
        fixRotationAroundAxis in interface PhysicsBody
        Parameters:
        axisBody - an arbitrary direction in body space
        scalerInertia - the scaler inertia value around axisBody

      • getInvMass

        public final double getInvMass()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Returns one divided by the mass of the object. A body with infinite mass returns a value of zero.
        Specified by:
        getInvMass in interface PhysicsBody
        Returns:
        The multiplicative inverse of the mass.

      • getMass

        public final double getMass()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Returns the mass of the object. If the mass of the object is infinite (PhysicsBody.getInvMass() is zero) then this value is Infinity.
        Specified by:
        getMass in interface PhysicsBody
        Returns:
        The mass of the object.

        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody

        Specified by:

      • getInvI

        public final Matrix3 getInvI()
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Returns the inverse of the moment of inertia tensor. This value is always valid even when some axes of rotation are locked.
        Specified by:
        getInvI in interface PhysicsBody
        Returns:
        3x3 matrix representing the inverse of the inertia tensor.

      • enactImpulse

        public void enactImpulse(Vector3 impulse,
                         Vector3 relativePos)
        Description copied from interface: PhysicsBody
        Enacts an instantaneous impulse on this body. Collisions use this method to instantaneously change the momentums of this PhysicsBody.
        Specified by:
        enactImpulse in interface PhysicsBody
        Parameters:
        impulse - Instantaneous force with units Force*Time
        relativePos - Position of the impulse relative to the center of mass of this body
